metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5847 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The gst_asf_demux_process_ext_content_desc function in gst/asfdemux/gstasfdemux.c in gst-plugins-ugly in GStreamer allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds heap read) via vectors involving extended content descriptors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5847` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gstreamer0.10-plugins-ugly - 0.10.19-2+deb7u1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-ugly0.10 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.10.19-2+deb7u1ubuntu0.1').
gst-plugins-ugly1.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
